content: [NAV_START] About Us Our Services Resources Book appointment Contact Us Dashboard Signup Login [NAV_END] EN All Posts General 5 min read # What is the Medicare levy and how does it affect my tax return? Written by Published on January 11, 2024 The Medicare levy helps fund part of the costs of the Australian public health system known as Medicare. This tax corresponds to 2% of your taxable income, in addition to the tax you pay on your taxable income. It's possible to obtain a reduction or exemption from paying the Medicare levy, depending on your circumstances and those of your spouse. You should consider separately your right to a reduction or exemption. The Medicare levyis collected in the same way as income tax. Generally, the amount your employer withholds from your salary or wages includes an amount to cover the Medicarelevy. The ATO calculates the Medicare levy payable when you lodge your tax return. How to apply for a Medicare exemption certificate: To obtain a Medicare Entitlement Statement (MES), there are two application methods: online application through myGov or completion of a form. Apply Online: 1. Through MES Dashboard: - Use the Medicare Entitlement Statement (MES) dashboard in the
